notes: Fixed Newtonsoft.Json dependency - now uses built-in .NET serialization.
author: BadBuddhaCustoms
changelog: Added ability to set custom risk reward
Removed external Newtonsoft.Json dependency for maximum compatibility
Switched to JavaScriptSerializer with manual enum handling (no external dependencies)
Fixed settings persistence using built-in .NET Framework serialization
Fixed bracket scaling to always have 4 sets at 25% each by default
Fixed duplicate R:R ratios in dropdown menus
Improved enum serialization for hotkeys (saves as readable strings)
Added 2 fully configurable breakeven buttons (BE+1, BE+2)
Each breakeven button can be enabled/disabled independently in settings
Each breakeven button supports custom tick values
Added configurable trailing stop feature with custom tick distance
Trailing stop tracks highest/lowest price and moves stops automatically
Trailing stop only moves in favorable direction (never against position)
Trailing stop auto-disables when position closes
Added new 'Breakeven & Trailing' tab in Settings window
Visual feedback with color changes (green when active)
Settings persist across sessions and reboots via JSON file
Comprehensive tooltips and help text
Configurable Risk:Reward ratios (1:1, 1:2, 1:3, 2:1, 3:1, custom)
Hotkeys: Ctrl+Shift+B (toggle), Ctrl+Shift+R (cycle R:R)
Real-time visual overlay showing R:R, SL, TP during drag
Exactly 4 bracket sets for position scaling (must total 100%)
Sound alerts for successful placement and errors
Debug logging to file
